DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Greater Than or Equal To 100 Milligrams Enhancing Tumor And 100 Milligrams Non Enhancing Tumor Resection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the resection will include at least 0.10 cm3 (100 mg) of tumor from enhancing tumor and at least 0.10 cm3 (100 mg) from non-enhancing tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Greater Than or Equal To 100 Milligrams Enhancing Lesion And Non Enhancing Lesion Resection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than ninety-nine and less than one hundred-one and the quantity that it denotes._A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce._A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of an enhancing agent._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of an enhancing agent._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To One Hundred Milligram Enhancing Lesion And Negation Enhancing Lesion Excision
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A natural number greater than ninety-nine and less than one hundred-one and the quantity that it denotes.:A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.:A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of an enhancing agent.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of an enhancing agent.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than ninety-nine and less than one hundred-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of an enhancing agent.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of an enhancing agent.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for ABTC 1401 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao. mc 2/4/2015

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the surgeon expect to re
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the surgeon expect to resect at least 0.10 cm3 (100 mg) of tumor from enhancing tumor and at least 0.10 cm3 (100 mg) from non-enhancing tumor with low risk of inducing neurological injury?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1701 TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the surgeon expect to resect 0.05-0.10 cm3 (50-100 mg) of tumor from enhancing tumor and at least 0.05-0.10 cm3 (50-100 mg) from non-enhancing tumor with low risk of inducing neurological injury?

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for ABTC 1401 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao. mc 2/5/15
